contents.title: Understanding Errors
contents.content:
Errors are problems that occur during code execution. Proper error handling makes applications robust and user-friendly.

Types of Errors:

1. Syntax Errors:
   â€¢ Typos in code
   â€¢ Missing brackets/semicolons
   â€¢ Caught before execution
   â€¢ Example: let x = ;  (missing value)

2. Runtime Errors:
   â€¢ Occur during execution
   â€¢ Invalid operations
   â€¢ Example: accessing undefined variable

3. Logical Errors:
   â€¢ Code runs but gives wrong result
   â€¢ Hardest to find
   â€¢ Example: wrong formula

Common Error Types:
â€¢ ReferenceError: Variable not defined
â€¢ TypeError: Wrong type operation
â€¢ SyntaxError: Invalid syntax
â€¢ RangeError: Number out of range
â€¢ URIError: Invalid URI

Why Handle Errors?
â€¢ Prevent app crashes
â€¢ Better user experience
â€¢ Easier debugging
â€¢ Graceful degradation
â€¢ Log errors for analysis
